TopicTitle: [WIP] Dreamer - SNC Dream Chaser - Download Available!

Edited November 17, 2014 by artwhaley

whoa that's awesome although the textures seem to be a bit under detailed... which i can't help you with due to lack of experience but if you do release tis is would proscribe using Lack IVA for his LLL Rovers as a temporary placeholder.
Nice little shuttle! Do you plan FAR\NEAR and DRE support?

Helix... I hope to get better at texturing as I go forward... and I'll keep updating it. It's way better than my last attempt, I promise.

Biohazard... Yes... but not right away.

I'm considering moving the hatch to the very top... and possibly adding a cargo bay.

The top hatch is accurate to the original... the cargo bay isn't... but might be a fun item to have... and would give detail to the biggest, most boring part of the model.

artwhaley, I'd love to help you texture this project. I'm fairly new to modding so I have no work to show you, but I come from an animation background. I'm looking to get involved and help out on some projects. Message me if you're interested!

Helix... I hope to get better at texturing as I go forward... and I'll keep updating it. It's way better than my last attempt, I promise.

oh i hope i didn't offend you, i meant it to be friendly constructive criticism in the hopes that you can improve

but still keep up the great work

mech_engr - I'd LOVE help with the texturing! I'll shoot you a PM to talk about details.

Helix - no offense taken at all! The whole reason for posting a WIP is to get feedback on what others see, because when you've been staring at a model for a few days the things that look good-enough to you may jump out at someone else as obviously in need of work.... and vice versa - the things you feel like you just can't get right may be the things others love. I definitely took it as constructive!

Art

I tried a version with the top hatch and cargo bay and I think it's an improvement. Two pictures added to the album.

Edited September 11, 2014 by artwhaley
Nice work Artwhaley, that really looks the part. perhaps a bit too big?
Spectacular! Inspiring even.
It's a bit big, not to mention it looks a bit too Kerbal for my liking. I'd love to have an actual Dream Chaser modeled in KSP, scaled to the Community ISS.

I for one have no problem with Kerbal liberties. This is truly a wonderful looking ship. However I have to agree with the consensus thus far it does look a little too big. I don't know if its the pictures and the angles you have chosen but, from what I have seen it looks too big. The other thing I recommend is adding little things to the outside to make it pop. Some textures, logos, greeblys (little non useful things and pieces) to add accent and scale. The textures look a little too plain right now. I understand this is a WIP progress and I apologize if you have more planned. However like I said this looks wonderful and I can't wait to play with. I think what you do need to focus on is the scaling it does seem quite large. If thats what you are going for then leave it exactly the way it is. If you are truly going for a dream chaser idea then it needs be smaller.
Any chance of posting the DEV version you have so people can play around with scaling? Always helps to have a few peoples input..or maybe not:D
I'm agreeing with the feedback on size. Here it is rescaled to .75... and I think I like it better!

I'm agreeing with the feedback on size. Here it is rescaled to .75... and I think I like it better!

http://i.imgur.com/U0HLnkf.png

http://i.imgur.com/8neutly.png

Much Much better
Does it have built-in solar panels or a generator (a config file generator)?
I'm gonna say a generator is important.

Love it! Subscribed, i would do a test version if possible, and also the adaptor is sorta wrong....

Edited September 14, 2014 by kenbobo

Mini-shuttles seem to be in vogue lately

Nice model, subscribing to test it once released.
Any updates?

Nothing of note yet, but I'm hoping for exciting updates soon! I did a bit of cleanup on the model - dealing with the cargo bay and moving the hatch to the top. Mech_engr is working on a completely new texture for it. As soon as he's done with that I'll get it split back up and put together in Unity and get a test version up here for people to play with!

Art
How much fuel does it hold?

Nothing of note yet, but I'm hoping for exciting updates soon! I did a bit of cleanup on the model - dealing with the cargo bay and moving the hatch to the top. Mech_engr is working on a completely new texture for it. As soon as he's done with that I'll get it split back up and put together in Unity and get a test version up here for people to play with!

Art

Best update ever!

The exact fuel capacity is going to depend on how the weight gets tweaked to make the aerodynamics work. It will be based on the delta v for common missions. I don't want it to be unrealistically awesome, but I do want it to be newbie friendly. .. To me that mean it at least needs to be capable of something like a 500 m/s circularization, 100 m/s inclination adjustment, 150 m/s transfer, and 200 m/s deorbit. It seems that puts it pretty close to the deltaV required to capture, dock, then return from the Mun, if the launch vehicle made the initial transfer burn and you carefully planned the munar orbit's inclination.

Anyone have thoughts on what they'd want it to do?
